thread.title: Fact-checking the first 30 days of the Donald Trump administration
thread.title_full: Fact-checking the first 30 days of the Donald Trump administration - Houston Chronicle

author: chron.com
title: Fact-checking the first 30 days of the Donald Trump administration
text:
Photo: Olivier Douliery, TNS Image 1 of / 36 Caption
Close
Image 1 of 36 Fact-checked: Trump team's first 30 days
Trump recently rounded off his first 30 days in office with a false claim of a terror attack occurring in Sweden.
Click through to see biggest falsehoods to come from the White House in the first 30 days of the new administration.
less Fact-checked: Trump team's first 30 days
Trump recently rounded off his first 30 days in office with a false claim of a terror attack occurring in Sweden.
Click through to see biggest falsehoods to come from the ... more Photo: Olivier Douliery, TNS Image 2 of 36 Day 1 - On Trump's relationship with the CIA
The Quote: : "The media ... sort of made it sound like I had a feud with the intelligence community." Date: January 21, 2017 Who said it: President Donald Trump Politifact truth rating: False Why: His tweets say otherwise.
Source: Politifact less Day 1 - On Trump's relationship with the CIA
The Quote: : "The media ... sort of made it sound like I had a feud with the intelligence community." Date: January 21, 2017 Who said ... more Photo: Pool/Getty Images Image 3 of 36 Day 1 - On inauguration crowd size
The Quote: : "That was the largest audience to witness an inauguration, period." Date: January 21, 2017 Who said it: White House Press Secretary Sean Spicer Politifact truth rating: Pants on Fire Why: Crowd figures and photographs disprove Spicer.
Source: Politifact less Day 1 - On inauguration crowd size
The Quote: : "That was the largest audience to witness an inauguration, period." Date: January 21, 2017 Who said it: White House Press Secretary Sean Spicer Politifact truth ... more Photo: Alex Wong/Getty Images Image 4 of 36 Day 4 - On evidence of voter fraud
The Quote: : "There's one (study) that came out of Pew in 2008 that showed 14 percent of people who voted were noncitizens." Date: January 24, 2017 Who said it: White House Press Secretary Sean Spicer Politifact truth rating: False Why: Fact-checkers can't trace Spicer's statistics to any real study.
Source: Politifact less Day 4 - On evidence of voter fraud
The Quote: : "There's one (study) that came out of Pew in 2008 that showed 14 percent of people who voted were noncitizens." Date: January 24, 2017 Who said ... more Photo: BRENDAN SMIALOWSKI/AFP/Getty Images Image 5 of 36 Day 6 - On murder rate in Philadelphia
The Quote: : "Here in Philadelphia murder has been steady — I mean — just terribly increasing." Date: January 26, 2017 Who said it: President Donald Trump Politifact truth rating: False Why: Trends show murder rate is actually decreasing.
Source: Politifact less Day 6 - On murder rate in Philadelphia
The Quote: : "Here in Philadelphia murder has been steady — I mean — just terribly increasing." Date: January 26, 2017 Who said it: President Donald ... more Photo: NICHOLAS KAMM, Staff Image 6 of 36 Day 7 - On travel restrictions from the Middle East
The Quote: : "If you were a Muslim, you could come in, if you were a Christian, it was impossible." Date: January 27, 2017 Who said it: President Donald Trump Politifact truth rating: False Why: Thousands of Christian refugees have entered the country.
Source: Politifact less Day 7 - On travel restrictions from the Middle East
The Quote: : "If you were a Muslim, you could come in, if you were a Christian, it was impossible." Date: January 27, 2017 Who said it: President ... more Photo: Richard Drew, Associated Press Image 7 of 36 Day 10 - On Mexico's largest source of income
The Quote: : "Here's the fact: The No. 1 source of income into Mexico are Mexicans working here and sending the money back." Date: January 30, 2017 Who said it: Kellyanne Conway, counselor to the president Politifact truth rating: Pants on Fire Why: U.S. purchases of Mexican goods are the number one source of income for Mexico.
Source: Politifact less Day 10 - On Mexico's largest source of income
The Quote: : "Here's the fact: The No. 1 source of income into Mexico are Mexicans working here and sending the money back." Date: January 30, 2017 Who said ... more Photo: AP Image 8 of 36 Day 13 - On the lack of a Secretary of the T reasury
The Quote: : "This is longest that the nation has gone without a secretary of the Treasury, at least in modern times. If it's not the longest, it's darn close to it." Date: February 2, 2017 Who said it: Kellyanne Conway, counselor to the president Politifact truth rating: False Why: The nation waited more than twice as long in 2013.
Source: Politifact less Day 13 - On the lack of a Secretary of the T reasury
The Quote: : "This is longest that the nation has gone without a secretary of the Treasury, at least in modern times. If it's not the longest, it's ... more Photo: BLOOMBERG Image 9 of 36 Day 13 - On the "Bowling Green massacre"
The Quote: : "Two Iraqis came here to this country, were radicalized and they were the masterminds behind the Bowling Green massacre. … It didn't get covered" Date: February 2, 2017 Who said it: Kellyanne Conway, counselor to the president Politifact truth rating: False Why: "Bowling Green massacre" never happened.
Source: Politifact less Day 13 - On the "Bowling Green massacre"
The Quote: : "Two Iraqis came here to this country, were radicalized and they were the masterminds behind the Bowling Green massacre. … It didn't get ... more Photo: Charles Krupa, Associated Press Image 10 of 36 Day 16 - On his immigration ban and executive order
The Quote: : "109 people out of hundreds of thousands of travelers" were affected by the immigration ban. Date: February 5, 2017 Who said it: President Donald Trump Politifact truth rating: False Why: At least 60,000 travels were affected.
Source: Politifact less Day 16 - On his immigration ban and executive order
The Quote: : "109 people out of hundreds of thousands of travelers" were affected by the immigration ban. Date: February 5, 2017 Who said ... more Photo: Pablo Martinez Monsivais, STF Image 11 of 36 Day 17 - On terrorist attacks not being reported
The Quote: : "It's gotten to a point where it's not even being reported, and in many cases, the very, very dishonest press doesn't want to report it." Date: February 6, 2017 Who said it: President Donald Trump Politifact truth rating: Pants on Fire Why: Extensive coverage exists of terror attacks cited by Trump's administration.
Source: Politifact less Day 17 - On terrorist attacks not being reported
The Quote: : "It's gotten to a point where it's not even being reported, and in many cases, the very, very dishonest press doesn't want to report ... more Image 12 of 36 Day 18 - On the nation's murder rate
The Quote: : "The murder rate in our country is the highest it’s been in 47 years." Date: February 7, 2017 Who said it: President Donald Trump Politifact truth rating: False Why: 1990s had the highest murder rate in recent decades.
Source: Politifact less Day 18 - On the nation's murder rate
The Quote: : "The murder rate in our country is the highest it’s been in 47 years." Date: February 7, 2017 Who said it: President Donald Trump Politifact truth ... more Photo: Steve Helber, STF Image 13 of 36 Day 23 - On Bernie Sanders calling CNN fake news
The Quote: : "While on FAKE NEWS @CNN, Bernie Sanders was cut off for using the term fake news to describe the network. They said technical difficulties!"
Date: February 12, 2017
Who said it: President Donald Trump
Politifact truth rating: False Why: Bernie Sander's interview continued after technical difficulties were fixed.
Source: Politifact less Day 23 - On Bernie Sanders calling CNN fake news
The Quote: : "While on FAKE NEWS @CNN, Bernie Sanders was cut off for using the term fake news to describe the network. They said technical difficulties!"
Date: ... more Photo: Andrew Harnik, AP Image 14 of 36 Day 23 - On illegal voters in New Hampshire
The Quote: : "This issue of busing voters in to New Hampshire is widely known by anyone who’s worked in New Hampshire politics. It’s very real, it’s very serious." Date: February 12, 2017 Who said it: Stephen Miller, White House senior adviser. Politifact truth rating: Pants on Fire Why: Zero evidence exists to support Miller's claim.
Source: Politifact less Day 23 - On illegal voters in New Hampshire
The Quote: : "This issue of busing voters in to New Hampshire is widely known by anyone who’s worked in New Hampshire politics. It’s very real, it’s very ... more Photo: Andrew Harrer, Bloomberg Image 15 of 36 Day 27 - On leaks and leakers
The Quote: : "The spotlight has finally been put on the low-life leakers!"
Date: February 16, 2017
Who said it: President Donald Trump
Politifact truth rating: Full Flop
Why: Trump often praised leaks during campaign: "Boy, I love reading those WikiLeaks!"
Source: Politifact less Day 27 - On leaks and leakers
The Quote: : "The spotlight has finally been put on the low-life leakers!"
Date: February 16, 2017
Who said it: President Donald Trump
Politifact truth rating: Full Flop
Why: Trump often ... more Photo: Olivier Douliery, TNS Image 16 of 36 Day 29 - On terror attacks in Sweden
The Quote: : "Look at what’s happening last night in Sweden. Sweden, who would believe this? Sweden. They took in large numbers. They’re having problems like they never thought possible." Date: February 18, 2017 Who said it: President Donald Trump Politifact truth rating: False Why: Zero fatal terrorist attacks have occurred in Sweden since 2010.
Source: Politifact less Day 29 - On terror attacks in Sweden
The Quote: : "Look at what’s happening last night in Sweden. Sweden, who would believe this? Sweden. They took in large numbers. They’re having problems like they ... more Photo: Chris O'Meara, STF Image 17 of 36 Day 29 - On vetting refugees
The Quote: : "There was no way to vet those people. There was no documentation. There was nothing." Date: February 18, 2017 Who said it: President Donald Trump Politifact truth rating: False Why: Refugee vetting program has existed since the 1980s.
Source: Politifact less Day 29 - On vetting refugees
The Quote: : "There was no way to vet those people. There was no documentation. There was nothing." Date: February 18, 2017 Who said it: President Donald ... more Photo: Chris O'Meara, STF Image 18 of 36 LIST: The biggest Texas lies
Politifact, a fact-checking site, rates statements with either a "false" or "pants on fire."
Click through to see the biggest lies ever told about Texas. LIST: The biggest Texas lies
Politifact, a fact-checking site, rates statements with either a "false" or "pants on fire."
Click through to see the biggest lies ever told about Texas. Image 19 of 36 On the "war on BBQ"
The lie: Austin is imposing "a ban on barbecue restaurants." Said by: Rush Limbaugh, host of The Rush Limbaugh Show Date: July 28th, 2015 Rating: Pants on Fire
Source: Politifact.com On the "war on BBQ"
The lie: Austin is imposing "a ban on barbecue restaurants." Said by: Rush Limbaugh, host of The Rush Limbaugh Show Date: July 28th, 2015 Rating: Pants on Fire
Source: Politifact.com Photo: Yelp Image 20 of 36 On Texas being conservative
The lie: "All of Texas is conservative, except a little bit of Austin." Said by: Sean Hannity, FOX radio and telivision host. Date: August 23, 2016 Rating: False
Source: Politifact.com less On Texas being conservative
The lie: "All of Texas is conservative, except a little bit of Austin." Said by: Sean Hannity, FOX radio and telivision host. Date: August 23, ... more Image 21 of 36 On equal pay in Texas
The lie: "Texas is one of only a handful of states that does not have an equal pay law." Said by: Wendy Davis, Democratic politician Date: March 14, 2016 Rating: False
Source: Politifact.com less On equal pay in Texas
The lie: "Texas is one of only a handful of states that does not have an equal pay law." Said by: Wendy Davis, Democratic politician Date: March 14, ... more Image 22 of 36 On Texas women and abortions
The lie: "Statistics show two to three Texas women per week have major complications and 10 women per week seek help at an ER after an abortion." Said by: Ken Paxton, Texas Attorney General Date: February 5, 2016 Rating: False
Source: Politifact.com less On Texas women and abortions
The lie: "Statistics show two to three Texas women per week have major complications and 10 women per week seek help at an ER after an abortion." Said by: Ken Paxton, Texas ... more Photo: Eric Gay, STF Image 23 of 36 On ISIS
The lie: "ISIS camp a few miles from Texas, Mexican authorities confirm." Said by: Judicial Watch, conservative watchdog group. Date: April 14, 2015 Rating: False
Source: Politifact.com On ISIS
The lie: "ISIS camp a few miles from Texas, Mexican authorities confirm." Said by: Judicial Watch, conservative watchdog group. Date: April 14, 2015 Rating: False
Source: Politifact.com Photo: Uncredited, HONS Image 24 of 36 On ISIS (again)
The lie: "At least 10 ISIS fighters have been caught coming across the Mexican border in Texas" and there are "dozens more that did not get caught by the Border Patrol." Said by: Duncan Hunter, United States Representative Date: October 7, 2014 Rating: Pants on Fire
Source: Politifact.com less On ISIS (again)
The lie: "At least 10 ISIS fighters have been caught coming across the Mexican border in Texas" and there are "dozens more that did not get caught by the Border Patrol." Said by: Duncan ... more Image 25 of 36 On Texas' rainy day fund
The lie: Texas this fiscal year will "have more money in reserve than the other 49 states combined." Said by: Dan Patrick, Texas Lt. Governor Date: February 25, 2015 Rating: Pants on Fire
Source: Politifact.com less On Texas' rainy day fund
The lie: Texas this fiscal year will "have more money in reserve than the other 49 states combined." Said by: Dan Patrick, Texas Lt. Governor Date: February 25, 2015 Rating: Pants on ... more Photo: Laura Skelding, MBO Image 26 of 36 On the University of Texas
The lie: "Students at the University of Texas in Austin have been advised not to wear cowboy boots or cowboy hats on Halloween." Said by: Todd Starnes, FOX news radio host. Date: October 28, 2016 Rating: False
Source: Politifact.com less On the University of Texas
The lie: "Students at the University of Texas in Austin have been advised not to wear cowboy boots or cowboy hats on Halloween." Said by: Todd Starnes, FOX news radio ... more Photo: Eric Gay, STF Image 27 of 36 On Obama never visiting the Texas-Mexico border
The lie: "Unlike this president, I’ve actually gone to the border and been there with the governor of Texas." Said by: Scott Walker, Wisconsin Governor Date: April 25, 2015 Rating: False
Source: Politifact.com less On Obama never visiting the Texas-Mexico border
The lie: "Unlike this president, I’ve actually gone to the border and been there with the governor of Texas." Said by: Scott Walker, Wisconsin Governor Date: ... more Photo: Olivier Douliery, MBR Image 28 of 36 On prayer rugs near the border
The lie: "Prayer rugs have recently been found on the Texas side of the border in the brush." Said by: David Dewhurst, former Lieutenant Governor of Texas Date: September 26, 2014 Rating: Pants on Fire
Source: Politifact.com less On prayer rugs near the border
The lie: "Prayer rugs have recently been found on the Texas side of the border in the brush." Said by: David Dewhurst, former Lieutenant Governor of Texas Date: September 26, ... more Photo: BRETT COOMER, STAFF Image 29 of 36 On human trafficking
The lie: "25 percent of human trafficking victims are located in Texas." Said by: John Cornyn, United States Senator from Texas Date: January 10, 2014 Rating: Pants on Fire
Source: Politifact.com less On human trafficking
The lie: "25 percent of human trafficking victims are located in Texas." Said by: John Cornyn, United States Senator from Texas Date: January 10, 2014 Rating: Pants on ... more Photo: Gary Coronado, Houston Chronicle Image 30 of 36 On Texas' vaccination rate
The lie: "When I came into office, our vaccination rate in Texas was 65 percent. When I left two weeks ago, it was 95 percent." Said by: Rick Perry, former Texas governor. Date: February 5, 2014 Rating: False
Source: Politifact.com less On Texas' vaccination rate
The lie: "When I came into office, our vaccination rate in Texas was 65 percent. When I left two weeks ago, it was 95 percent." Said by: Rick Perry, former Texas governor. Date: ... more Photo: KENA BETANCUR, Stringer Image 31 of 36 On Texas gun laws
The lie: In Texas, "it's legal to shoot someone who's committing a ‘public nuisance’ under the cover of dark." Said by: Robert Reich, former U.S. Labor Secretary Date: June 8, 2013 Rating: False
Source: Politifact.com less On Texas gun laws
The lie: In Texas, "it's legal to shoot someone who's committing a ‘public nuisance’ under the cover of dark." Said by: Robert Reich, former U.S. Labor Secretary Date: June 8, ... more Image 32 of 36 On engine manufacturers
The lie: "Every engine manufacturer in the United States is now in the state of Texas." Said by: Rick Perry, former Texas Governor Date: September 18, 2013 Rating: False
Source: Politifact.com less On engine manufacturers
The lie: "Every engine manufacturer in the United States is now in the state of Texas." Said by: Rick Perry, former Texas Governor Date: September 18, 2013 Rating: ... more Photo: Carolyn Kaster, STF Image 33 of 36 On bars on college campuses
The lie: "We don’t have bars on campus in Texas. It’s against the law... no alcohol allowed." Said by: Jeff Wentworth, former member of the Texas Senate. Date: February 22, 2011 Rating: Pants on Fire
Source: Politifact.com less On bars on college campuses
The lie: "We don’t have bars on campus in Texas. It’s against the law... no alcohol allowed." Said by: Jeff Wentworth, former member of the Texas Senate. Date: February 22, ... more Photo: Edward A. Ornelas, San Antonio Express-News Image 34 of 36 On the Moon landing
The lie: "The first word spoken from the moon was 'Houston.'" Said by: Rick Perry, former Texas governor. Date: January 18, 2011 Rating: False
Source: Politifact.com On the Moon landing
The lie: "The first word spoken from the moon was 'Houston.'" Said by: Rick Perry, former Texas governor. Date: January 18, 2011 Rating: False
Source: Politifact.com Photo: NEIL ARMSTRONG, HO Image 35 of 36 On Texas' economy
The lie: Texas' "economy is about 30 percent larger than that of Australia." Said by: Larry Kilgore, Texas secessionist. Date: November 23rd, 2012 Rating: False
Source: Politifact.com On Texas' economy
The lie: Texas' "economy is about 30 percent larger than that of Australia." Said by: Larry Kilgore, Texas secessionist. Date: November 23rd, 2012 Rating: False
Source: Politifact.com Image 36 of 36 Fact-checking the first 30 days of the Donald Trump administration 1 / 36 Back to Gallery One job with positive prospects for the next four years is fact-checker.
The new administration of President Donald Trump has kept them busy since day one, beginning with Sean Spicer's delivery of a confident and tension-filled declaration about the president's inauguration crowd size.
Most recently, Trump claimed a terror attack happened in Sweden, despite no evidence of one ever occurring.
Since the start of the new administration, the White House has shown little sign of stopping what Senator John McCain said was an alarming increase in the unwillingness and inability "to separate truth from lies."
POLL: More Texans are taking a fancy to Trump, feeling optimistic
Pulitzer Prize winning fact-checking site Politifact has been kept particularity busy, juggling statements from Trump and his top advisers almost every day.
Critics of the left like Naval War College professor Tom Nichols, who wrote an opinion piece for The Washington Post , believe the media is quick to overreact to Trump on ordinary matters, arguing that the American public just isn't used to a decisive transition.
But if the extra fact-checking-- some happening in real-time during the president's press conferences-- is any indication of the next four-years, it may be a sign that the Trump team is operating on a different wavelength than previous administrations.
During a rally on Saturday, President Donald Trump left the world scratching their heads after suggesting that a terror attack had happened in Sweden the evening before. "You look at what's happening last night in Sweden," Trump said. As Sweden itself was quick to confirm, no such incident had occurred — so they reached out to the U.S. to clarify what the president had meant.
Media: Brandpoint LONE STAR LEADERSHIP: Donald Trump may be unpopular, but Texas congressmen love him
For example, during Obama's first 30 days in office, Politifact rated one statement by the new president "false."
In comparison, Trump's first 30 days have received eight false ratings and one "pants on fire" rating.
Click through above to get a more in-depth and fact-checked look at the president's first 30 days office.
